subject: New Cover for the UK
event: The good folks at Harper Collins Voyager, my publishers in the United Kingdom and Australia, have informed me that they've changed the cover for the forthcoming DANCE WITH DRAGONS hardcover. They've decided to go with the same cover art as on the American edition, though the design and background colors will vary. Here's the old UK cover: And here's the new one: I know the long delay with DANCE has frustrated many of you... but hey, it's certainly provided a lot of gainful employment for book designers and cover artists. I wonder if I deserve a line in the Guinness Book of World Records: the unpublished book with the most covers. This one should stick, though. July 12. Coming soon.

comments.article: Pre-ordered from amazon.ca with whatever cover turns up, it's what's between the covers that matters after all! Although I have (and adore!) my Kindle, certain books still need to be in tangible form for me. For example, I just read on Kindle Lisa Tuttle's "The Silver Bough" and after finishing it, immediately ordered the "hard copy" version too, 'cause I couldn't keep such a lovely book only in digital form. Your work, Mr. Martin, I've yet to get in Kindle form because I already have most, if not all, in tangible books and that certainly won't change with ADwD.

comments.upictitle: The Tower of the Otherworld: destiny
comments.article: I had rather fancied the US cover and so am pleased that Harper Collins have changed to it.

With respect, while cover art is important, its not the be all and end all. They are all cool and I like them.

What I would like to know is: Since Dance is the second part of FfC and takes place simultaneously, when can we expect "The Winds of Winter"? I am asking this with the greatest respect for my favorite author, who does not like to be rushed. But this has been a very long wait. I am a bit worried that the vastly increased publicity, public appearances etc etc though the HBO series will take away even more writing time. Why not just finish the series, then go on every Convention, tour etc that comes along. I had cancer in 2009 and while I am recovered now (hopefully), one of the things that would have annoyed me most would been to croak before I can read the conclusion of the ASoIaF series. Here is hoping. We all wish you the best of health and creativity.
